channel.title: City in Focus Podcast
channel.description: City in Focus Breakfast Series - Selected Recordings
channel.itunes:summary: For over eighteen years City in Focus has sponsored events in the City which encourage people to build bridges between their faith and their life in the city. Half of the people who attend these activities are not active in their faith. Many of them are open to issues of faith and trying to understand the relevance of the Christ in their own personal and professional lives.
channel.itunes:author: City in Focus

item.title: Blake Bromley - GIVING: Suprlus, Obligatory or Sacrificial for Brand, Cause or God?
item.itunes:author: City in Focus
item.dc:creator: City in Focus
item.description: GIVING: Suprlus, Obligatory or Sacrificial for Brand, Cause or God? Blake Bromley is an authority on Canadian charity law. As Principal of Benefic Lawyers, his practice relates almost exclusively to charitable, estate and tax planning matters. Blake has incorporated and registered well over 600 registered charities and non-profit organizations. Blake is globally recognized as an expert on the comparative laws of charity and regularly advises charities and donors operating around the world on tax and legal issues, specifically the international transfer and utilization of charitable funds as well as on matters of corporate control, strategy and structure. He has advised governments in China, Russia, Vietnam, Australia, England, South Africa and Eastern Europe on drafting their laws governing rights and tax privileges of social organizations. Currently, Blake is the lead foreign consultant to the government of China in its effort to draft the countrys first law of charity. Blake and his wife, Marion, reside in Vancouver and they have three grown children, Kathryn, John and Serena.

item.title: Tetsuro Shigematsu - This Hour has 22 Minutes: Keeping Up the Pace and Living Well
item.itunes:author: City in Focus
item.dc:creator: City in Focus
item.description: This Hour has 22 Minutes: Keeping Up the Pace and Living Well. Tetsuro Shigematsu is a Canadian radio broadcaster, comedian and filmmaker. He was the most recent host of CBC Radio One's former afternoon series The Roundup. Prior to working for CBC Radio, he was a writer for the Canadian TV show This Hour Has 22 Minutes. Shigematsu, who's parents emmigrated from Japan, grew up in Vancouver and received a BFA from Concordia University. He later studied poetry with Allen Ginsberg.Throughout his career, Shigematsu has written, performed, and directed shows and films around the world. In 2007, Tetsuro completed his feature film debut Yellow Fellas, which he wrote & directed. In his 20 years in the entertainment industry, Shigematsu has received accolades for film and performance routines. Currently, he spends his time teaching and studying at UBC. He resides in Vancouver with his wife and two young children.

item.title: Mario Canseco - Walking the Line: Ethical Decision-Making in Opinion Polling and Research.
item.itunes:author: City in Focus
item.dc:creator: City in Focus
item.description: Walking the Line: Ethical Decision-Making in Opinion Polling and Research. As Vice President of the Public Opinion Poll, Mario Canseco is responsible for designing survey questionnaires on a wide range of sociological and political issues. Delving into the conundrums that policy researchers face on a daily basis, Mario draws on his earlier career in journalism to achieve the concept of detachment—becoming an impartial observer who is seeking to find out how people feel about an issue—as opposed to trying to shift public opinion through tricks. Mario has walked this fine line of ethical polling for more than 100 legislative and presidential elections around the world, granting hundreds of interviews to discuss poll results and provide commentary about international politics. His articles on international politics have appeared in numerous publications, including Time, the Vancouver Sun, the Ottawa Citizen, theLatin American Advisor, The Tyee, Common Ground, Aduanas and La Razon. Mario will be speaking on the choices and issues facing those who do research. Mario has worked in the election teams for all the democratic processes that have been covered by Angus Reid using its unique online methodology, including the 2008 Canadian Federal Election. Mario holds an MJ from the University of British Columbia, and a BA in Communication from Mexico City’s Universidad Iberoamericana.

item.title: Bob Rennie - Are Christians relevant in the city?
item.itunes:author: City in Focus
item.dc:creator: City in Focus
item.description: Are Christians relevant in the city? For over 35 years, Rennie Marketing Systems has been at the forefront of marketing new developments and advising the Developers and the industry at large in the city of Vancouver and beyond. Rennie Marketing Systems is one of the leading condominium sales and marketing firms in North America. Founded by Bob Rennie, creator of the team’s approach and success, Rennie Marketing Systems is recognized for envisioning and growing one of the most sophisticated condominium markets in the world – being Vancouver and is often credited for changing the City’s skyline. Bob has been marketing real estate since 1975 and has become a household name and recognized as one of the top authorities in the local economy. With a passion for contemporary art, Bob chairs the North America Acquisitions Committee (NAAC) at the Tate Museum of Modern Art in London as well as sits on the Dean's Advisory Board to the Faculty of Arts at the University of British Columbia. He was recently appointed onto the Emily Carr University Board of Governors. Bob is also on the board for the Streetohome Foundation, a local organization that aims to help ensure that people who are homeless in Vancouver have access to safe, decent, affordable housing and support services. Bob has recently taken a personal interest in stabilizing Vancouver’s Chinatown, restoring the oldest building in Chinatown to house his offices and a Contemporary Art Museum, at the Wing Sang Building, 1889.
